intro: Calyptranthes lindeniana var. americana, commonly known as the American calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and cloves. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a slight aromatic scent. This species is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shaded areas.
